CraftingBench.title: Crafting Bench
CraftingBench.description: A workspace occupying a 5x5 square allows characters to craft items more easily. This does not replace the artisans' tools necessary for specific crafting projects.
CraftingBench.benefit: Items cost 5 gp less to craft in downtime.

FurnishingsandDecor.title: Furnishings and Decor
FurnishingsandDecor.description: Make your house a home with softer beds, more comfortable sofas, a washbasin in every bedroom, or even a small fire elemental heating your bath.
FurnishingsandDecor.benefit: Taking a Long Rest in the manor provides 2/4/10 temporary HP.

Library.title: Library
Library.description: Tomes of many subjects line the walls of a cozy room built for those who thirst for knowledge (or who enjoy a little light reading).
Library.benefit: Characters gain Advantage on Intelligence checks made in the library. The upgraded library also allows you to roll an additional 1d4 and drop the lowest when resolving the Research downtime activity.

ArcaneLibrary.title: Arcane Library
ArcaneLibrary.description: In addition to the Basic or Upgraded Library, Distinguish your library with additional volumes of rare books of and about magic, which are most valuable to any arcane spellcaster.
ArcaneLibrary.benefit: In addition to the benefit(s) above, once a day, one arcane caster may cast one spell of their class (no higher than 3rd level) as a ritual. Spells above the spellcaster's level require a check with DC 10 + spellcasting modifier.

PigeonLoft.title: Pigeon Loft
PigeonLoft.description: Not just pets, but helpers! A well-kept pigeon loft is erected on the rooftop, with trained pigeons who always come home.
PigeonLoft.benefit: Once a day, you may send a message to a designated partner location or send a pigeon home.

RoofGarden.title: Roof Garden
RoofGarden.description: A beautiful roof garden, full of flowers, herbs, and benches where you can sit and watch the colorful birds and butterflies that visit.
RoofGarden.benefit: The garden gives a free source of herbs for medicine, cooking, potions, and poisons. Potions cost 5gp less to brew in downtime.

ScribingDesk.title: Scribing Desk
ScribingDesk.description: A fine desk occupying a 5x5 square - perhaps in a library? - allows characters to scribe spellscrolls more easily.
ScribingDesk.benefit: Spell scrolls cost 5gp less to scribe in downtime.

Shrine.title: Shrine
Shrine.description: A room, corner, small building, or tree dedicated to the worship of a deity of your choice who will receive praise and possibly answer prayers.
Shrine.benefit: A Long Rest in the manor charges a Token of Favor, allowing one player to reroll a 1 on d20 check, as long as the action does not conflict with the deity's dogma. The upgraded shrine also allows you to roll an additional 1d4 and drop the lowest when resolving the Service downtime activity.

ConsecratedShrine.title: Consecrated Shrine
ConsecratedShrine.description: In addition to Basic or Upgraded Shrine, A donation to the god's temple is rewarded with a consecration ceremony that allows a devotee to strengthen their bond with the god.
ConsecratedShrine.benefit: In addition to the benefit(s) above, once a day, one divine caster may cast one spell of their class (no higher than 3rd level) as a ritual. Spells above the spellcaster's level require a check with DC 10 + spellcasting modifier.

SecretExit.title: Secret Exit
SecretExit.description: A hidden tunnel behind the bar. A door masked by a wardrobe. Voila! Handy for making quick escapes.
SecretExit.benefit: The doorway requires prior knowledge or a DC 10/15/20 to discover. High-quality exits also grant advantage on the Stealth check required by the Theft downtime activity.

SecurityEnhancements.title: Security Enhancements
SecurityEnhancements.description: Reinforced shutters and doors protect the structure from outside threats. For a little extra, your floorboards chirp like birds when even the stealthiest of intruders steps on them.
SecurityEnhancements.benefit: Players gain full cover if attacked from outside. For upgraded enhancements, install up to 10 5x5 squares of flooring which alerts anyone on the same floor to movement.

MagicalSecurity.title: Magical Security
MagicalSecurity.description: A spellcaster will enchant a door or window to raise the alarm in the form of a mental ping or a loud ringing bell in the event of intruders.
MagicalSecurity.benefit: A selected door or window is equipped with the Alarm spell for the duration.

Vault.title: Vault
Vault.description: A secure, fortified space, complete with traps and a sturdy dwarf-made door. Perfect for storing treasures and income.
Vault.benefit: Your vaulted space is equipped with a DC 18/23 lock and 1/2 setback trap(s). The upgraded vault also has 1 dangerous trap (as outlined in the Basic Rules).

Aquarium.title: Aquarium
Aquarium.description: Want to provide a calming, ethereal display for your patrons or bring a little nature indoors? Just add water! And fish.

CobbledStreet(s).title: Cobbled Street(s)
CobbledStreet(s).description: Well-laid streets allow heavy carts to travel even during rain or snow, saving overhead costs and increasing clientele. They also increase the overall quality and appearance of the neighbourhood.
CobbledStreet(s).benefit: Increases revenue 10 gp per tenday. Upgraded cobbled streets grant advantage once a day on Persuasion checks to neighbors.

BeerEngine.title: Beer Engine
BeerEngine.description: A dwarven-invented mechanical apparatus that propels cask ale from the cellars to hand pumps at the bar, allowing taverns to serve customers at greater speed.
BeerEngine.benefit: At luxury tier, also increases revenue 1gp per tenday.

BeerGarden.title: Beer Garden
BeerGarden.description: Outside seating allows customers to escape the smoke and grime of the tavern interior. It also raises the respectability of your establishment.
BeerGarden.benefit: Grants bonus of +1 / +2 / +2 on Persuasion checks made in the garden. The luxury tier beer garden also allows you to roll an additional 1d4 and drop the lowest when resolving the Carousing downtime activity if on location.

FightingPit.title: Fighting Pit
FightingPit.description: Tucked away from the taproom in a repurposed cellar, a secret fighting pit allows patrons to taste the thrill of the fight-or of the betting pool.
FightingPit.benefit: Alters valuation -1 / +0 / +1. Grants bonus of +1 / +2 / +2 on attack rolls made in the pit. The highest tier fighting pit also gives Advantage on the Unarmed Strike check when resolving the Money-Making (Pit Fighting) downtime activity if on location.

GamblingTable.title: Gambling Table
GamblingTable.description: Late at night, unbeknownst to the City Watch, in a secret corner (or snug), the dice roll and prayers are muttered to Tymora, the Lady of Luck.
GamblingTable.benefit: Grants bonus of +1 / +2 / +2 on Insight checks made at the table. The luxury tier gambling table also gives Advantage on the Insight check when resolving the Money-Making (Gambling) downtime activity if on location.

Lavatory.title: Lavatory
Lavatory.description: Most taverns make do with an outhouse or chamber pot for patrons; building a lavatory indoors will make customers feel pampered and more likely to stay for another round.

Snug.title: Snug
Snug.description: A room with frosted glass protects the privacy of those who would pay a little extra to be drink away from prying eyes.
Snug.benefit: Grants bonus of +1 / +2 / +2 on Deception checks made in the snug. The luxury tier snug also allows you to roll an additional 1d4 and drop the lowest when resolving the Spreading Rumors downtime activity if on location.

Stage.title: Stage
Stage.description: A raised platform gives a natural place for bards, actors, or tipsy amateur poets to perform and entertain tavern patrons.
Stage.benefit: Grants bonus of +1 / +2 / +2 on Performance checks made on the stage. The luxury tier stage also gives Advantage on the Performance check when resolving the Money-Making (Performing) downtime activity if on location.

UpgradedCellar.title: Upgraded Cellar
UpgradedCellar.description: A stone-lined cellar allows the tavern to stockpile wines and spirits at temperature and hold reserves of ale inside giant storage barrels.
UpgradedCellar.benefit: At luxury tier, also increases revenue 1gp per tenday.

UpgradedHearth.title: Upgraded Hearth
UpgradedHearth.description: The center of any room is the hearth, and a taproom is no exception. An upgraded hearth elevates the atmosphere (and the temperature, on cold nights).
UpgradedHearth.benefit: At luxury tier, also increases revenue 1gp per tenday.

UpgradedKitchen.title: Upgraded Kitchen
UpgradedKitchen.description: Providing food is the very first step to better service; an upgraded kitchen comes with more room for more cooking techniques and faster service.
UpgradedKitchen.benefit: At luxury tier, also increases revenue 1gp per tenday.

UpgradedLarder.title: Upgraded Larder
UpgradedLarder.description: A storage area for wholefood supplies with a cool room for perishables. The fresher the ingredients, the better the meal!
UpgradedLarder.benefit: At luxury tier, also increases revenue 1gp per tenday.

UpgradedTaproom.title: Upgraded Taproom
UpgradedTaproom.description: The taproom is the heart of your tavern. A basic taproom has spit-and-sawdust floors, worn tables, and cracked mugs; a a luxury-level taproom would have polished floors and crystal.
UpgradedTaproom.benefit: At luxury tier, also increases revenue 1gp per tenday.
